body:
I removed the use of ObjectSpace.each_object and instead am using ObjectSpace._id2ref () so that I'm no longer iterating over all objects, but just pulling the objects out with object_ids which are associated with the transaction. I check if these objects have been garbage collected using a uuid in AR.

I've made a particularly simple benchmark and tested AR speed inside of transactions with the speed using the current implementation in ruby 1.9.3: https://gist.github.com/4617394. It seems that speed of both are comparable, but I'd like to hear your thoughts on different benchmarks because I don't think I necessarily choose a good one.
